UI_visible_response: “Cover-Up Class” is a clever play on words that humorously twists the term “Proletariat.” The Proletariat traditionally refers to the working class in Marxist theory, who are often seen as oppressed and exploited. In contrast, “Cover-Up Class” suggests a group of people who are adept at concealing or suppressing information, perhaps to maintain power or control. This term humorously contrasts the idea of the oppressed working class with those who actively hide the truth.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: “Cover-Up Class” is a clever play on words that humorously twists the term “Proletariat.” The Proletariat traditionally refers to the working class in Marxist theory, who are often seen as oppressed and exploited. In contrast, “Cover-Up Class” suggests a group of people who are adept at concealing or suppressing information, perhaps to maintain power or control. This term humorously contrasts the idea of the oppressed working class with those who actively hide the truth.
